title_en: Minister’s statement on the Cowichan Valley Transit dispute
summary_en: Jennifer Whiteside, Minister of Labour, has issued the following statement on the Cowichan Valley Transit System labour dispute:

title_en: Wildfire risk will continue into fall
summary_en: People should continue to use caution and take steps to be prepared by staying up to date on current conditions, following fire prohibitions and being Firesmart, as the risk of wildfire is expected to continue into fall.

title_en: People invited to shape the Xwulqw’selu (Koksilah) Water and Watershed Sustainability Plan
summary_en: People are invited to share their input to help guide the development of the Xwulqw’selu (Koksilah) Water and Watershed Sustainability Plan (the Plan) and shape long-term solutions for water supply and ecosystem health.

title_en: Expanded substance-use supports available for youth in B.C.
summary_en: More female, female-identifying and non-binary youth living with substance-use challenges can access expanded support through 12 new treatment beds in Surrey.

title_en: Planning process underway to reconnect Tk̓emlúps te Secwépemc lands to downtown Kamloops
summary_en: A planning process is underway to explore options for reconnecting Tk̓emlúps te Secwépemc lands and Kamloops as Friday, Sept. 19, 2025, marks one year since the Red Bridge, a vital connection between these communities, was destroyed by a fire.

title_en: Coroner’s inquest into the death of Matthew Scott Causton announced
summary_en: A coroner’s inquest into the circumstances surrounding the death of Matthew Scott Causton is scheduled to start at 9:30 a.m. on Wednesday, Nov. 12 through to Friday, Nov. 21, 2025.

title_en: New provincial task force will target extortion threats
summary_en: The Province, B.C. RCMP and municipal police agencies are launching a specialized task force to strengthen investigations into the extortion threats targeting families and businesses in the South Asian community.

title_en: Exit closure on Highway 99 will support 78th Street interchange
summary_en: Drivers are advised southbound Exit 23 from Highway 99 to 80th Street will close starting today, Wednesday, Sept. 17, 2025, for approximately seven weeks, as work advances on the new 78th Street interchange.

title_en: Building a more connected government
summary_en: People will be at the centre of better service delivery as the Province establishes Connected Services BC, a more connected technology systems model that works better for people and businesses interacting with government.

title_en: Additional support will address gender-based violence in B.C.
summary_en: As part of the Canada-British Columbia bilateral agreement to end gender-based violence, B.C. will receive $18 million this year from the federal government to support survivors and break the cycle of violence through Safe and Supported: B.C.’s Gender-Based Violence Action Plan.

title_en: Premier, ministers travel to Ottawa to move major projects forward
summary_en: Premier David Eby is leading a mission to Ottawa to push for more investment in major infrastructure projects that deliver prosperity and jobs for people in B.C.

title_en: John Horgan Campus opens in Langford
summary_en: The new Royal Roads University (RRU), John Horgan Campus is open, offering innovative post-secondary options for a growing number of students living in the Westshore.

title_en: B.C. strengthens clinical research bringing more jobs, better care to people
summary_en: Better access to new life-saving medical treatments is coming with the launch of an eight-bed clinical trials unit (CTU) at Mount Saint Joseph Hospital in Vancouver.

title_en: Ksi Lisims LNG advances with environmental certificate
summary_en: The Indigenous-led Ksi Lisims LNG project has received its environmental assessment certificate.

title_en: New grants will help counter racism, promote inclusivity
summary_en: People in B.C. will see stronger, more inclusive communities as local organizations can now apply for provincial grants that back projects fighting racism and promoting multicultural understanding.

title_en: Environmental assessment certificate granted for Ksi Lisims LNG project
summary_en: A B.C. environmental assessment certificate has been issued for the Ksi Lisims LNG project, following a joint decision by provincial ministers.

title_en: Work underway to reopen Bamfield Main Road by end of October
summary_en: The Ministry of Transportation and Transit continues leading efforts to safely reopen Bamfield Main Road in co-operation with Mosaic Forest Management, following recent wildfire impacts.

title_en: B.C. economy in strong position to weather global trade uncertainty
summary_en: B.C.’s economy remains steady despite disruption and uncertainty from the global trade conflict, its First Quarterly Report shows.

title_en: Minister’s, parliamentary secretary’s statement on Consent Awareness Week 2025
summary_en: Jessie Sunner, Minister of Post-Secondary Education and Future Skills, and Jennifer Blatherwick, parliamentary secretary for gender equity, have released the following statement in recognition of Consent Awareness Week 2025:

title_en: New community-based teacher-education programs will increase First Nations K-12 teachers
summary_en: The Province, in partnership with the First Nations Education Steering Committee (FNESC) and the Indigenous Adult and Higher Learning Association (IAHLA), is supporting the development of First Nations-led community-based teacher-education programs to address the significant shortage of First Nations teachers in the province.

title_en: More B.C. youth trained for growing biomanufacturing industry
summary_en: Young people facing barriers to employment throughout British Columbia will have more opportunities to find jobs in the life-sciences industry.

title_en: Rail Safety Week promotes safety, awareness in B.C.
summary_en: The BC Coroners Service, together with the Ministry of Transportation and Transit and CN, is encouraging people in B.C. to learn more about rail safety to help save lives and prevent serious injuries during Rail Safety Week 2025.

title_en: Update on overnight closure planned for Highway 1 construction at Tank Hill
summary_en: Drivers are advised that Highway 1 at Tank Hill, 14 kilometres east of Lytton, will be closed overnight from 11 p.m., Monday, Sept. 15, until 7 a.m., Tuesday, Sept. 16, 2025.

title_en: Premier’s statement on Firefighters’ National Memorial Day
summary_en: Premier David Eby has issued the following statement on Firefighters’ National Memorial Day:

title_en: New health centre will open soon in Ucluelet
summary_en: People living in and around Ucluelet will have better access to team-based primary care when doors open on Monday, Sept. 22, 2025, to the Ucluelet Health Centre.

title_en: Nearly 600 new homes proposed for Surrey
summary_en: A new proposal in Surrey will bring almost 600 new homes and shelter spaces to the community through three new BC Housing-funded developments helping to support hundreds of people and families in need of affordable and supporting housing.

title_en: Substance-use recovery community centres open in Abbotsford, Hope
summary_en: People living with substance-use challenges will soon benefit from expanded access to community-based recovery supports with the opening of Abbotsford Junction and Hope Junction, two new recovery community centres in the Fraser Valley.

title_en: B.C. launches mandatory early literacy screening to help students succeed
summary_en: Early literacy screening will help students with reading challenges, including those with dyslexia and other learning disabilities, to get help with reading sooner.

title_en: 400 new affordable homes coming to Metro Vancouver
summary_en: People living in Metro Vancouver will soon have access to more affordable housing with 400 new rental homes opening and breaking ground in Coquitlam, North Vancouver and Vancouver.

title_en: Overnight closure planned for Highway 1 construction at Tank Hill
summary_en: Drivers are advised that Highway 1 at Tank Hill, 14 kilometres east of Lytton, will be closed overnight from 11 p.m. Sunday, Sept. 14, 2025, until 7 a.m. Monday, Sept. 15, 2025.

title_en: People on Piers, Texada, southern Vancouver Island get internet connectivity
summary_en: Accessing high-speed internet for people in approximately 750 households will soon become a reality as more rural Vancouver Island and Gulf Island communities are connected.

title_en: Minister’s statement on provincial meat inspectors
summary_en: Lana Popham, Minister of Agriculture and Food, has released the following statement about provincial meat inspectors being classified as essential workers:

title_en: Affordable, accessible homes open for seniors in Valemount
summary_en: Seniors, including those with mobility challenges, are moving into 18 affordable, accessible homes close to services and amenities in Valemount, helping them stay connected to the community they know and love.

title_en: Province adds training seats for nurse practitioners throughout B.C.
summary_en: The Province has added 65 nurse practitioner (NP) training seats to three post-secondary institutions, making training accessible in five regions throughout the province and supporting the growth of B.C.’s health-care workforce.

title_en: More youth will be supported with tools to prevent addiction, substance use
summary_en: More young people will soon have better access to the tools they need to manage stress, build resilience and prevent early substance use and mental-health challenges with the expansion of drug- and substance-use prevention supports.

title_en: Construction starts on Cranbrook long-term care home
summary_en: Construction is beginning on a new and expanded long-term care facility in Cranbrook.

title_en: Province extends funds for drop-in services to help people in Downtown Eastside
summary_en: People experiencing homelessness will benefit from continued day-space drop-in services, as the Province extends funding to Watari Counselling and Support Services (Watari) and Aboriginal Front Door Society (AFDS).

title_en: Port Alberni roundabout will improve traffic flow, safety
summary_en: A new roundabout at Highway 4 and Beaver Creek Road will make travel safer for residents, marina users and tourists heading to and from the west coast of Vancouver Island.

title_en: Seniors in Maple Ridge will benefit from nearly 100 new affordable homes
summary_en: Seniors in Maple Ridge will have access to more affordable housing with construction starting on 98 homes.

title_en: New homes underway for youth, mothers in New Westminster
summary_en: Youth transitioning out of foster care, and young mothers in New Westminster are closer to having a safe, stable place to live as construction starts on a new 89-home development in the community.

title_en: High-speed connectivity coming to north Vancouver Island, northern, central coast
summary_en: People in more than 400 households will soon have better access to high-speed internet as 11 more rural Vancouver Island, northern and central coast communities get connected.

title_en: Ongoing support, services benefit adults with mental-health issues
summary_en: Adults living with mental-health challenges will continue to have access to low- or no-cost counselling services to help them get well.

title_en: Temporary orders protect chinook salmon in Thompson Okanagan
summary_en: As severe drought conditions continue to affect river levels in the Thompson Okanagan region, fish-population protection orders will protect endangered chinook salmon in the Salmon River and Bessette Creek by temporarily restricting water use for forage crops and identified industrial purposes.

title_en: Affordable homes underway for people in Quesnel
summary_en: People with low to moderate incomes in Quesnel, including Indigenous Elders, seniors and families, will soon have access to safe, affordable housing with construction underway on 35 new rental homes.

title_en: Shelter spaces added in Greater Victoria for people experiencing homelessness
summary_en: People experiencing or at risk of homelessness now have more safe places to stay with the opening of 25 additional temporary shelter spaces at the Victoria Native Friendship Centre (VNFC) in Saanich, bringing its total number of overnight shelter spaces to 50.

title_en: Coquihalla Highway reopened following wildfire closure
summary_en: The Coquihalla Highway (Highway 5) between Hope and Merritt has reopened in both directions following a closure caused by the Mine Creek wildfire.

title_en: Province appoints new associate judge for B.C. Supreme Court
summary_en: A new associate judge has been appointed to the Supreme Court of British Columbia, adding to the court’s capacity to provide timely and fair access to justice throughout the province.

title_en: Minister’s statement on the Cowichan Valley transit labour dispute
summary_en: Jennifer Whiteside, Minister of Labour, has issued the following statement on the Cowichan Valley transit labour dispute:

title_en: New chair appointed for appeals board regulating skilled trades in B.C.
summary_en: Richard Grounds was appointed to a three-year term as chair of the Skilled Trades BC Appeal Board (STBCAB) effective Monday, Aug. 18, 2025.

title_en: Minister’s statement on August Labour Force Survey results
summary_en: Ravi Kahlon, Minister of Jobs and Economic Growth, has issued the following statement on the release of Statistics Canada’s Labour Force Survey for August 2025:

title_en: Two allied health profession programs expanded to Vancouver Island
summary_en: The University of British Columbia (UBC) in partnership with the University of Victoria (UVic) has expanded two allied health profession programs, a master of physical therapy and a master of science in speech-language pathology, to Vancouver Island.

title_en: Coroner’s inquest will review deaths of Duong-Nguyen family members
summary_en: A coroner’s inquest into the circumstances surrounding the deaths of Janet Nguyen, Christopher Duong, and Alexander and Harlan Duong, is scheduled for Monday, Oct. 6, until Friday, Oct. 24, 2025.

title_en: New Nelson health campus will support people of all ages
summary_en: People in Nelson and nearby communities now have improved access to care with the opening of the Nelson community health campus.

title_en: Carrier Sekani First Nations and B.C. renew commitment to reconciliation
summary_en: The Province and seven Carrier Sekani First Nations are re-affirming their shared commitment to implementing a long-term, collaborative vision for reconciliation.

title_en: Building up Surrey with 1,000 new student seats on the way
summary_en: Surrey’s ongoing infrastructure expansion continues with Clayton Heights Secondary adding 1,000 new student seats for families.

title_en: New middle school coming for Kelowna students
summary_en: With funding approved for a new middle school, 800 new seats are coming to support students in Kelowna.

title_en: More francophone schools coming to B.C.
summary_en: To better support francophone students in Abbotsford and Victoria Westshore, land has been purchased to build French-language schools.

title_en: Minister’s statement about returning to school
summary_en: Lisa Beare, Minister of Education and Child Care, has issued the following statement about returning to learning:

title_en: Premier’s, minister’s statements on Labour Day
summary_en: Premier David Eby has issued the following statement marking Labour Day:

title_en: Minister’s statement after 2025 meeting of Canadian Council of Fisheries and Aquaculture Ministers
summary_en: Randene Neill, Minister of Water, Land and Resource Stewardship, has released the following statement after the annual meeting of the Canadian Council of Fisheries and Aquaculture Ministers (CCFAM) in Iqaluit, Nunavut, on August 28 and 29, 2025:

title_en: Province takes lead to reopen Bamfield Main Road
summary_en: The Ministry of Transportation and Transit is now leading efforts to safely reopen Bamfield Main Road, in co-operation with Mosaic Forest Management.

title_en: Minister’s statement on first tobacco litigation payment
summary_en: Niki Sharma, Attorney General, has released the following statement in response to British Columbia receiving its first payment as part of the historic litigation against tobacco companies:

title_en: New, expanded schools opening for Langley students
summary_en: A new school and two new additions are now open for K-12 students in Langley, bringing more than 900 new seats to the district, with thousands more on the way.

title_en: BC Transit services expand in Fort St. John
summary_en: People using handyDART services in Fort St. John will see improved and expanded travel options with the introduction of additional hours of service on Sundays from September 2025.

title_en: BC Transit services expand in Kamloops
summary_en: People using transit in Kamloops will see improved and expanded transit options with extended hours of service on several routes starting Monday, Sept. 1, 2025.

title_en: BC Transit services expand in Comox Valley
summary_en: People using transit in the Comox Valley will see improved and expanded transit options with the introduction of handyDART service on statutory holidays starting Monday, Sept. 1, 2025.

title_en: Province issues permit for expansion of Mount Polley mine
summary_en: The Ministry of Mining and Critical Minerals has approved Imperial Metal’s permit to expand its Mount Polley mine in the Cariboo region, which will extend the mine’s life by eight years, support local jobs and continue environmental monitoring as part of ongoing regulatory requirements.

title_en: Framework agreement reached between Facilities Bargaining Association, Health Employers Association of B.C. under 2025 Balanced Measures Mandate
summary_en: The Province is announcing significant progress at one of the negotiations taking place under the 2025 Balanced Measures Mandate.

title_en: Ministers provide consent for Mount Polley Springer Pit expansion project
summary_en: The ministers of Environment and Parks, Tamara Davidson, and Mining and Critical Minerals (MCM), Jagrup Brar, have issued a consent order to Mount Polley Mining Corporation for a material alteration to the Mount Polley Mine to expand its Springer Pit.

title_en: Resources available to support campus overdose prevention, response
summary_en: As post-secondary students prepare to head back to class for the fall semester, students and staff are reminded of the resources available to prevent and respond to overdoses on campus.

title_en: Grants offer more creativity opportunities for people
summary_en: Community Gaming Grants are empowering organizations, artists and cultural workers by strengthening arts and culture programming and services to increase opportunities for people in British Columbia to participate in the arts and culture sector.

title_en: More child care spaces coming to schools throughout B.C.
summary_en: Families in 12 communities throughout the province are benefiting from 640 new child care spaces on school grounds, expanding access to high-quality child care for young children, as well as before- and after-school care.

title_en: Planned Highway 1 improvements in Duncan area will boost pedestrian safety
summary_en: The Ministry of Transportation and Transit is improving safety along Highway 1 in the Duncan-North Cowichan area with the installation of new fencing and boulevard upgrades.

title_en: Stay prepared, travel safely this Labour Day long weekend
summary_en: As people in B.C. prepare to celebrate the Labour Day long weekend before students return to school, people are encouraged to plan ahead, stay safe and be prepared for seasonal risks.

title_en: More than 3,000 new student seats opening in B.C.
summary_en: As families prepare to send kids back to school in September, new schools and additions are opening in several growing communities, with thousands more spaces under construction throughout British Columbia.

title_en: New classrooms opening, more on the way for Surrey students
summary_en: New classrooms are opening and being built to create thousands of new student seats in Surrey.

title_en: Government supports six francophone initiatives in B.C.
summary_en: Government is investing $250,000 to support six non-profit organizations in delivering initiatives that reflect the needs and priorities of British Columbia’s francophone communities.

title_en: Annual rent increase falls for second straight year capped at inflation
summary_en: More people will be able to stay in an affordable home near their jobs, schools and loved ones as the Province ties the annual allowable rent increase to inflation at 2.3% in 2026, down from 3% in 2025.

title_en: B.C. sets standard method to measure forest carbon
summary_en: To address a recommendation from the auditor general, the Province has established a method for carbon modelling in timber supply reviews (TSRs).

title_en: Tall Timber building boosts student housing at BCIT’s Burnaby campus
summary_en: The British Columbia Institute of Technology (BCIT) has officially opened its new Tall Timber student housing residence at the Burnaby campus, expanding affordable on-campus housing options for students.
